com.luke.lukef.lukeapp.tools

Class LukeUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.luke.lukef.lukeapp.tools.LukeUtils

  • public class LukeUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods to be used from anywhere in the app. Mainly parsing JSONObjects and JSONArrays into usable objects.

      • parseDateFromMillis

        public static java.lang.String parseDateFromMillis(long submission_date)
        Parses date from MS to the defined format
        Parameters:
        submission_date - The amount of milliseconds from the Jan 1, 1970 GMT to the desired date
        Returns:
        Date as String in defined format

      • parseDateFromString

        public static java.lang.String parseDateFromString(java.lang.String dateToParse)
        Parses the given String into a date object and outputs it in a different pattern.
        Parameters:
        dateToParse - Date as a String in the following pattern: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'.
        Returns:
        The given date, but in the following format: hh:mm dd/MM/yyyy.

      • checkGpsStatus

        public static boolean checkGpsStatus(android.content.Context context)
        Checks the current GPS status, if GPS is not enabled then calls alertDialogBuilder(Context, String, String) to create a prompt for the user to enable GPS.
        Parameters:
        context - Context, needed to create the alert.
        Returns:
        true if the GPS is enabled, false if it's not.

      • checkInternetStatus

        public static boolean checkInternetStatus(android.content.Context context)
        Checks the current Internet status, if Internet is not enabled then calls alertDialogBuilder(Context, String, String) to create a prompt for the user to enable Internet.
        Parameters:
        context - Context, needed to create the alert.
        Returns:
        true if the GPS is enabled, false if it's not.

      • alertDialogBuilder

        private static void alertDialogBuilder(android.content.Context context,
                                       java.lang.String alertText,
                                       java.lang.String settings)
        Creates an alert with Yes and No buttons.
        Parameters:
        context - Context, needed to start the given activity.
        alertText - The text to show in the alert.
        settings - The required android.provider.settings to open if user clicks Yes.

      • getCategoryObjectsFromJsonArray

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Category> getCategoryObjectsFromJsonArray(org.json.JSONArray jsonArr)
                                                                     throws org.json.JSONException
        Parses Category objects from the provided JSONArray. Compares the fetched categories to the existing categories, adds new discards old.
        Parameters:
        jsonArr - The JSONArray fetched from server.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException
